FK.content: [in Anidjar’s introduction] Hegel on Islam, no nationalism like Judaism [?] (lacks particularity); Islam has a universalism, Judaism doesn’t > Christianity has both

SPOM.content: there’s no nationalism, nationality, that’s not religious or mythological

OH.content: nationalism always a philosopheme, justifies itself in name of a privilege in the memory of the universal, of the transcendental, of the ontological > no one is more universal than the one that is we; cosmopolitanism & nationalism have always gotten on together

FWT.content: risk of nationalism and communitarianism [re: limits to solidarity] must be reevaluated at every moment
the nationalism of republican “universalism” protesting against “democratic” communitarianism almost always voiced by strongest community [Black Lives Matter]
nationalism always state-nationalism today: a zealous, jealous, vindictive vindication of nation as a sovereign state
technology [telephone, Internet, stock market] dissociates political field from territorial & national field > new concept of political is being forged

POOF.content: in every racism, nationalism, there’s a discourse on birth & nature, on genealogy (a phantasm on the genealogical phúsis)

what will be put into question re: fraternity is the exemplarist strategy (ethnocentrism, patriotism, nationalism), alleged universalism of nation, homeland: our homeland gives passage to homeland of all mankind
via Hugo, fraternity is universal in first being French, ‘sublimated France’: ‘natural law,’ ‘generosity,’ the brother

Gii.content: paradoxical/regular association of nationalism w/ cosmopolitanism, w/ humanism
profound link btwn Europocentric universalism, humanism & nationalism

IW.content: [vis-à-vis Rosenzweig] “unheard-of” singularity of Jewish nation: its birth belongs to (God’s) Law, not to nature > inscribed in a history that began before it was born (though it was already its own)—history of this nation: supernatural, transhistorical, prehistoric
Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito> not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national
“I” signs first in its spiritual language
for Fichte, conversely, nation is an ego> > relates to itself via egological subjectivity
truth of nationality is German idealism; the German spirit is the spirit of humanity
Cohen suspects a narcissistic infatuation in Fichte’s national ego, mirror of a certain psyché, but also room for any other self in this national self, cosmopolitan logic, national self as “We”
re: Heidegger & Cohen’s nationalist call to duty: let’s not imprudently bring these 2 gestures together, but not forget common web of a tradition
Cohen’s discourse about nationalism a discourse on sublime, sublimity of spiritual forms hand in hand w/ mathematization of rhythm: sources of feeling, originality of German music

exemplarism (center of our reflection on nationality): our Beispiel (example) must be followed as a model (Vorbild) to recognize our Vormacht (hegemony, preeminence): if Beispiel is exemplary, not indifferent case in series, then this statement is a tautology
exemplary as a pre-model, a pre-formative model, an ideal
via Renan, brutal unity of nation requires active, selective forgetting, one can’t tolerate something at origin of nation: act of originary violence, unavowable curse
national forgetting as remembering a future promise (promise structurally involves forgetting, essential indifference to past)
“desire to live together,” performative engagements, promises, inscribe necessity of forgetting in memory itself
soldier’s conscience: national development serves universal justice
Cohen defends war, ideal of state culminates in confederation of states
exemplarity (rather than paradigm): when “nation” declares itself, by virtue of its singularity, to be charged w/ exemplary testimony, universal message [e.g. Germans, Jews]

PJP.content: untranslatable [re: Le Parjure] resists passage across frontiers of a nation

EL.content: Scholem describes a move from national, exoteric [straightforward] Messianism to cryptographic, esoteric, elitist, apocalypticism accentuated by Jews losing their nation: the cryptic veil becomes “its very phenomenality, its state and its efficacy”

HST.content: Massignon: Abraham’s hospitality as a sign announcing the gathering of all nations

AD.content: absolute past: “word of God” —will have taken place before taking place, older than Sinai—truth of messianic exceeds national identity; p. 142n absolute “lateness”: older yes
not just Israel: all nationalisms think their exemplary
Levinas trying to delimit a faith in election safe from (à l’abri de) all “nationalist” temptation

CF.content: juridical tradition remains ‘mean-minded,’ restrictive, because under control of demographico-economic interests (Nation-State regulating asylum)
‘national reconciliation’ can appear honorable [re: crimes against humanity], but forgiveness not therapy of reconciliation
sovereignty of human metaphysically aligned w/ sovereignty of Nation, though often appeal to human rights aspires to limit powers of Nation-States
all Nation-States founded in violence, all culture a type of colonialism > foundation scripted into State order to hide itself, sublimation/celebration of beginning as amnesia
international law still depends too much on sovereign & powerful Nation-States

BSi.content: international rights & crimes against humanity invoke a sovereignty of man himself (ipse, ipsissimus) above/beyond/before Nation-State sovereignty (Schmitt sees this as Entpolitisierung, humanity not a political concept)
Schmitt: “concept of humanity” useful instrument of ideological expansion; Proudhon: whoever invokes humanity wants to cheat
for Schmitt, what’s terrifying (schrecklich) about a Nation’s pretentious appeal to “humanity” is how such a nation treats its enemy as hors la loi, hors l’humanité—treats them like beasts
Schmitt doesn’t like hypocrisy of humanistic allegation/alibi > unehrliche Fiktion (dishonest fiction) of total depoliticization, peace w/out States
